oai_dc:dc.dc:title: [Islamic hymns] : manuscript, undated
İlahiler
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written in two columns, from 10 to 13 lines per page, in black rubricated in red. Text framed within triple golden and black lines.
Islamic hymns in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish. The maqams of the hymns and sometimes poets and composers are mentioned. Among the composers are Yusuf Efendi, Vehbi Çelebi, Hafız Ahmed Paşa, Ali Hoca.
MS Arab 21. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
Mostly in Arabic and some in Ottoman Turkish.
